intro: Eriogonum encelioides, commonly known as the yellow globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its yellow, globe-shaped flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. It has narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Eriogonum encelioides plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and wildlife.
